Pre-Game Insights: Anthony Gordon has staked his claim to start for England in Sunday's Euro 2024 last-16 clash with Slovakia, stating that he is a 'nightmare for anyone he plays against'.
Gordon believes that he adds a 'different element' to an England attack that has scored just two goals in three group games.
Gordon commented on his direct playing style, saying, 'I'm not a very safe player, I'm always going for it and trying to put people on the back foot.'
Gordon mentioned that his unpredictability and ability to win fouls can put teams on the back foot, adding that this is how he feels best playing.
Others: Gordon revealed he suffered a heavy fall following a high-speed electric bike accident but said it was not painful and just caused some cuts.
Gordon is fit to feature on Saturday, but the status of left-back Luke Shaw, who has been out since February due to a muscle injury, remains uncertain.
